critique: The executive order aims to address the urgent issue of displaced Jews in Europe and Palestine. It establishes a committee to assist the President in determining steps to be taken regarding Palestine and related problems. The order conveys a sense of urgency and determination to solve the problem. The emotions that should be conveyed are sadness (due to the plight of displaced Jews), and hope/joy (that the order will help solve the problem). There might also be a sense of surprise that the President is taking such decisive action. Disgust and fear are not relevant emotions in this context.
